nodes.name: Heart Disease
nodes.desc: In 2004, heart disease was noted on 68 percent of diabetes-related death certificates among people ages 65 years or older

nodes.name: Stroke
nodes.desc: In 2004, stroke was noted on 16 percent of diabetes-related death certificates among people ages 65 years or older

nodes.name: Hypertension
nodes.desc: In 2005–2008, of adults ages 20 years or older with self-reported diabetes, 67 percent had blood pressure greater than or equal to 140/90 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) or used prescription medications for hypertension.

nodes.name: Eye Complications
nodes.desc: In 2005–2008, 4.2 million—28.5 percent—people with diabetes ages 40 years or older had diabetic retinopathy

nodes.name: Kidney Disease
nodes.desc: Diabetes is the leading cause of kidney failure, accounting for 44 percent of all new cases of kidney failure in 2008

nodes.name: Nerve Damage (neuropathy)
nodes.desc: About 60 to 70 percent of people with diabetes have mild to severe forms of nervous system damage

nodes.name: Foot Problems
nodes.desc: Almost 30 percent of people with diabetes ages 40 years or older have impaired sensation in the feet

nodes.name: Depression
nodes.desc: People with diabetes are twice as likely to have depression, depression is associated with a 60 percent increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes.

nodes.name: Dental Disease
nodes.desc: About one-third of people with diabetes have severe periodontal disease

nodes.name: Complications of Pregnancy
nodes.desc: major birth defects in 5 to 10 percent of pregnancies and spontaneous abortions in 15 to 20 percent of pregnancies.
